image.altText: A blue and brown sign that reads 'Charles Darwin University', next to a road with lots of green trees shading it either side

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government says it's in negotiations with a university to open a prison work camp at a research farm north of the town of Katherine.

title.children: Record NT prison spend revealed as government flags location for work camp

image.altText: Jacinta stands in front of Peter Dutton. They are standing in front of Australian flag, Australia's emblem also seen.

props.synopsis: "Doubling down on cultural wars" and a misreading of the Voice referendum result contributed to the Coalition's election loss, says a former Liberal minister.

title.children: 'Wouldn't handle it that way': Former Liberal minister on 'culture war' campaign

image.altText: A teenage boy in a white hoodie and black baseball cap

props.synopsis: Three people convicted of murdering 18-year-old Kingsley Alley Jr after a dispute over a spilled drink have launched an appeal to have their guilty verdicts thrown out.

title.children: Trio jailed for NT teenager's murder claim 'miscarriage of justice'

image.altText: Raw vanadium rock

props.synopsis: Australian mining companies could benefit from US-China trade war, but they are walking a tightrope between their biggest export market in China and Australia's greatest ally in the US.

title.children: Australian miners see opportunities during US and China trade war chaos

image.altText: A dead ant lies on a reed in the bush.

props.synopsis: Some of the country's top scientists have been working with Indigenous rangers to access rugged parts of the Arnhem Land plateau that are rarely seen, even by traditional owners.

title.children: Zombie ants among striking finds as scientists explore Arnhem Land

image.altText: A woman dressed as a clown puts her arm around a woman in nurse's scrubs during an event on a sunny day in a park.

props.synopsis: Alice Springs residents have celebrated the warmth, openness and diversity of their community at the annual Bangtail Muster event.

title.children: 'Magic of friendship' on show at Bangtail Muster in Alice Springs

image.altText: A group of people walk on a street with banners

props.synopsis: After a local woman was allegedly murdered at the hands of her partner, her relatives and other members of the Fitzroy Crossing community have started a renewed push for change.

title.children: Woman's death sparks remote community's march and push for change

image.altText: Glen Oliver discovered a new variety of date palm ten years ago.

props.synopsis: Mitakoodi man Glen Oliver has nurtured a huge variety of plant species over the years, but the highlight of his career in horticulture has been discovering a new date palm.

title.children: Date variety discovered by outback horticulturalist now grown globally

image.altText: Doechii smizes while wearing a cream/yellow LV-embossed suit and holding a cigar, with a glorious afro.

props.synopsis: The 2025 Met Gala was all about self-expression and the contributions Black people have made to high fashion. Which celebrities nailed the theme?

title.children: The celebrities who nailed the 2025 Met Gala theme, according to experts

image.altText: close up of friedrich merz wearing glasses and he has a shocked look on his face

props.synopsis: Friedrich Merz secured just 310 votes in the lower house of parliament — six short of the 316 needed for a majority.

title.children: In a German first, Friedrich Merz has lost the vote to become chancellor

image.altText: Bejnamin Netanyahu wearing a navy jacket, white shirt and a gold and Israeli flag lapel pin while grimacing

props.synopsis: Israel has approved plans to seize the Gaza Strip and stay in the Palestinian territory for an unspecified amount of time, Israeli officials say.

title.children: Palestinians would be moved to Gaza's south under 'intensive' Israeli plan

image.altText: A man wearing an American Badass t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Most Greenlanders oppose the US president's threats to invade, but some believe it could give them leverage in their fight for independence from Denmark.

title.children: Greenland's problem? 'Not enough MAGA hats' to go around

image.altText: Michael McCormack 3 (1)

props.synopsis: Riverina MP and former deputy PM Michael McCormack says anyone not willing to cast a legitimate vote has no right to complain about the outcome of the election.

title.children: MP berates informal voters after dud ballot spike in NSW seat

image.altText: Kate Hulett and her supporters at an election night function

props.synopsis: Kate Hulett, who has said she will be "raging" against a proposed Woodside gas extension if elected, may be delivered to parliament thanks to the Liberals preferencing her above Labor.

title.children: Liberal preferences may help elect Climate 200-backed independent who vows to end gas

image.altText: An aerial shot of a film studio complex featuring many large warehouse-like buildings.

props.synopsis: Shock waves have been sent through the domestic film industry after US President Donald Trump announced his intention to slap a 100 per cent tariff on films "produced in foreign lands".

title.children: Trump's film tariffs throws Gold Coast vision into doubt, industry says

image.altText: Two small boys, with faces blurred, in a karate class.

props.synopsis: The Coonabarabran community in north-west NSW is in shock today after the "incomprehensible" deaths of two boys aged six and seven.

title.children: Grandmother likely to face 'serious charges' after deaths of two young boys

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns as he looks off camera while Xi Jinping stands behind him.

props.synopsis: America has decided to sever its trading relationship with China — a strategy that ultimately will come at enormous cost. And Australia, more than any other nation, will be caught smack in the middle.

title.children: The world is becoming a dangerous place. Australia is caught in the middle

image.altText: Plastic Garfield toy in packet

props.synopsis: The fast food chain has been fined more than $150,000 for breaching safety laws after putting 27,000 toys containing button batteries in children's meals with no warning.

title.children: Button batteries in fast food toys a 'loaded gun' as Hungry Jack's fined

image.altText: A group of men walking in black clothes, balaclavas and sunglasses to protect their identities.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne man's case will go to a contested hearing after he disputed the criminal nature of charges relating to his alleged role leading a white supremacist rally through Ballarat.

title.children: Thomas Sewell argues neo-Nazi rally was political but 'not offensive'

image.altText: Australian musician James Baker in 2024 lounging at home

props.synopsis: Australian punk rock pioneer James Baker, founding member of The Scientists, Hoodoo Gurus and The Beasts of Bourbon, has died from cancer at age 71.

title.children: James Baker, trailblazing Australian punk drummer, dies

image.altText: Blue and white police tape in front of traffic accident scene

props.synopsis: A flat battery has led two alleged e-bike hoons into the long arm of the law after a helicopter was used to track them on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Teenagers clocked going 120kph on e-bike but no charges laid

image.altText: Bad Bunny with his shirt off in front of a wood paneled wall.

props.synopsis: Hugely popular rapper and singer Bad Bunny has confirmed he will play his first Australian date as part of a huge, 12-month world tour.

title.children: One of music's biggest stars announces first Australian show

image.altText: Electricians place solar panels on roof

props.synopsis: Australian voters have overwhelmingly chosen household batteries over nuclear, rejecting the Coalition's anti-renewables agenda.

title.children: Solar uptake a clue to why Australians chose batteries over nuclear

image.altText: A sign for Bega Cheese on a fence with green grass around it.

props.synopsis: The cheese processing company will phase out operations at its Strathmerton site, which employs about 300 people.

title.children: Bega Cheese to close Victorian processing site to move jobs to NSW

image.altText: Electric vehicle plugged into a charger on a tree-lined city street.

props.synopsis: As new electric vehicle sales rise, more EVs are entering the used-car market. Are used-EV batteries any good, and how can you check?

title.children: How long can you expect a battery to last in a second-hand EV?

image.altText: James O'Connor runs with the ball

props.synopsis: Wallabies mentor Joe Schmidt has traded tips with Western Bulldogs coach Luke Beveridge and also talked up the prospects of James O'Connor.

title.children: O'Connor 'would bring experience' to Wallabies: Schmidt

image.altText: Palmer scratches his head.

props.synopsis: Despite spending $60 million on campaign advertisements, Clive Palmer's Trumpet of Patriots party has failed to win a single seat in the lower house.

title.children: After millions of dollars and texts, Trumpet of Patriots fails to deliver

image.altText: Josh Giddey with Benny's Boys players after a social game in Franskton.

props.synopsis: A social basketball team in Frankston did a double take when they saw Chicago Bulls star Josh Giddey suiting up for the opposition on Monday night.

title.children: 'This game's not going to go our way': NBA star crashes social game in Melbourne

image.altText: A stingray barb that was removed from the arm of Minlaton woman Pam Bennett.

props.synopsis: A volunteer marine researcher looking into marine deaths along South Australia's coastline was rushed to hospital after her arm was skewered by a 16-centimetre stingray barb. Yesterday, a dead white shark washed up on an Adelaide beach, with testing being conducted to determine a cause.

title.children: 'Not their normal behaviour': Snorkeler speared by stingray

image.altText: Elvis Smylie plays a shot

props.synopsis: Rising star Elvis Smylie has boosted Australia's US PGA Championship tilt to seven after earning a late special exemption to golf's second major of 2025.

title.children: Smylie gets US PGA Championship chance

image.altText: Woman in green shirt smiles leaning on man in white shirt who also smiles. A piano is in the background.

props.synopsis: Richard Tognetti is exacting, virtuosic and at the helm of one of the world's best chamber orchestras. He sits down with Virginia Trioli to talk work ethic, what brings him joy and what irks him.

title.children: Why the head of one of the world's best orchestras still worries about scales

image.altText: An old lady sits, leaning on a wall as she holds an empty metal pot.

props.synopsis: As people queue for hours for a bowl of soup, Israel maintains its blockade of food and aid — and the groups keeping people fed warn their supplies are running out.

title.children: Outside Gaza sits 116,000 tonnes of food as people inside run out

image.altText: An anonymous cardinal wearing bright red robes with gold accents looks up.

props.synopsis: In its 800-year history, a conclave has never been this diverse. How will this changing face of Catholicism impact the result of the papal vote?

title.children: 'He's one of us': Catholics around the world are watching the conclave

image.altText: Justis Huni poses, leaning on the top rope of a boxing ring

props.synopsis: After a tumultuous five-year career, Justis Huni is positioned to become just the third Australian to fight for the undisputed heavyweight world boxing title.

title.children: Huni 'comfortable being me' ahead of momentous opportunity

image.altText: Ezra Mam trains

props.synopsis: Brisbane coach Michael Maguire has decided not to play Ezra Mam against South Sydney, with the five-eighth to make his rugby league return for Souths-Logan instead.

title.children: Ezra Mam to make NRL return via Queensland Cup
